The word عَنْ comes from the root ع ن and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word قَوْمِكَ comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.

data.meanings: to hasten, make speed, accelerate, be hasty, act hastily, hurry over, do speedily. ajalun - precipitation, haste. ajil - that which hastens away, transitory. ista'jala - to seek or desire to hasten, urge one to make haste in doing anything. ijlun - calf.. . 'Ajiltu (prf. 1st. sing.): I have hastened.. 'Ajiltum (prf. 2nd. plu.): They make haste.. Laa Ta'jal (prt. neg. m. sing.): Thou make no haste.. Li Ta'jala (imp. 2nd. m. sing. el.). In order to make haste.. 'Ajjala (prf. 3rd. m. sing. II): He would have hastened.. 'Ajjalnaa (prf. 1st. plu. II): We hastened.. 'Ajala : Made you depart in such haste (with 'An).. Ta'jjala (prf 3rd. m. sing. V.): He hastened.. Ista'jaltum (prf. 2nd. m. plu. X.): You sought to be hastened.. Yasta'jiluuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. X.): They seek to expedite.. Tasta'jiluuna (imp. 2nd. m. plu.): You seek to hasten before its (fixed time), seek to expedite.. Laa Tasta'jil (prt. neg. m. sing. X.) : Thou do not seek to hasten.. Laa Tasta'jiluu (prt. neg. plu. X.): You do not seek to hasten.. 'Ajil (v. n.): Haste; Hurry up.. 'Aajilatun (act. pic. f. sing.): Quick-passing (world); Present (transitory life).. 'Ajuulan (acc. ints. n.): Ever hasty.. Isti'jaal (v. n. X.): Hastening.. 'Ijlun (n.): Calf.
data.sentence: The word أَعْجَلَكَ comes from the root ع ج ل and is associated with the meanings: to hasten, make speed, accelerate, be hasty, act hastily, hurry over, do speedily. ajalun - precipitation, haste. ajil - that which hastens away, transitory. ista'jala - to seek or desire to hasten, urge one to make haste in doing anything. ijlun - calf.. . 'Ajiltu (prf. 1st. sing.): I have hastened.. 'Ajiltum (prf. 2nd. plu.): They make haste.. Laa Ta'jal (prt. neg. m. sing.): Thou make no haste.. Li Ta'jala (imp. 2nd. m. sing. el.). In order to make haste.. 'Ajjala (prf. 3rd. m. sing. II): He would have hastened.. 'Ajjalnaa (prf. 1st. plu. II): We hastened.. 'Ajala : Made you depart in such haste (with 'An).. Ta'jjala (prf 3rd. m. sing. V.): He hastened.. Ista'jaltum (prf. 2nd. m. plu. X.): You sought to be hastened.. Yasta'jiluuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. X.): They seek to expedite.. Tasta'jiluuna (imp. 2nd. m. plu.): You seek to hasten before its (fixed time), seek to expedite.. Laa Tasta'jil (prt. neg. m. sing. X.) : Thou do not seek to hasten.. Laa Tasta'jiluu (prt. neg. plu. X.): You do not seek to hasten.. 'Ajil (v. n.): Haste; Hurry up.. 'Aajilatun (act. pic. f. sing.): Quick-passing (world); Present (transitory life).. 'Ajuulan (acc. ints. n.): Ever hasty.. Isti'jaal (v. n. X.): Hastening.. 'Ijlun (n.): Calf.
